intro: Cruciata glabra var. hirticaulis, commonly known as the hairy stem cruciata, is a variant of the cruciata glabra species. It is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
